snippet: In the suburbs of the United States, an expanding population of immigrants is faced with an absence of public transportation, scarcity of lawyers with immigration expertise and lack of opportunities to learn English.
abstract: Undocumented immigrants living in upstate New York face greater challenges than those who live near established networks of illegal immigrants around New York City; services that immigrants rely on, such as legal help, public transportation and language classes, are often absent in rural and suburban areas; advocates are seeking to expand such services ahead of Pres Obama's immigration initiatives.
lead_paragraph: In the suburbs of the United States, an expanding population of immigrants is faced with an absence of public transportation, scarcity of lawyers with immigration expertise and lack of opportunities to learn English.

headline.main: As Immigrants Settle Beyond City Limits, Help Is Hard to Find
headline.print_headline: As Immigrants Settle Beyond City Limits, Help Is Hard to Find
